channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Suspected gunman and five others die
item.description: A Plymouth MP says one of the victims was a child and more people are being treated in hospital.

item.title: Taliban claim capture of Kandahar, Afghanistan's second largest city
item.description: The fall of Afghanistan’s second largest city would be a crushing blow for the government.

item.title: Afghanistan: UK troops sent to get Britons out as Taliban advances
item.description: About 600 troops will be deployed on a short-term basis after the Taliban seized several cities.

item.title: Britney Spears' father steps down as conservator
item.description: The star had requested Jamie Spears be removed after accusing him of "conservatorship abuse".

item.title: Satanic forums visited by a killer uncovered
item.description: The BBC uncovers evidence about Satanic forums visited by killer Danyal Hussein.

item.title: Metabolism peaks at age one and tanks after 60, study finds
item.description: Middle-aged spread cannot be blamed on a waning metabolism, according to researchers.

item.title: Council policies often inconsistent with climate goals
item.description: A third of English councils support policies that could increase emissions, BBC research suggests.

item.title: Actress Una Stubbs dies aged 84
item.description: She was known for her roles in shows like Worzel Gummidge, Till Death Us Do Part and Sherlock.

item.title: Afghanistan: Desperation as thousands flee the Taliban
item.description: Yogita Limaye reports from a camp in Kabul where thousands who have been displaced by violence seek refuge.

item.title: Huge gulf in hospitals' ability to contain Covid
item.description: Hospital-acquired Covid ranged from 1% to 25% of cases in different hospitals.

item.title: CJ Ujah: British Olympic silver medallist suspended after positive test for banned substance
item.description: British sprinter CJ Ujah is suspended from competition after a positive test for a banned substance.

item.title: KFC warns menu items missing due to supply issues
item.description: The fast food chain has warned customers menus will be missing items as a result of the supply problems.

item.title: UK inhaler firm Vectura backs £1bn bid by Marlboro-maker
item.description: The bid by the maker of Marlboro cigarettes trumps a rival offer by US private equity firm Carlyle.

item.title: The papers: 'Plymouth death toll fears' and 'Operation Kabul'
item.description: Friday's papers focus on a serious firearms incident in Plymouth and UK troops returning to Afghanistan.

item.title: TV newsreader Victoria Derbyshire overcomes on-air shoe struggle
item.description: The BBC News channel presenter was seen quietly cursing as she struggled to put on her high heels.

item.title: Virtual reality: 'There's no max, there's no limit!'
item.description: "There's no max, there's no limit" to virtual reality, so is it the future of live music?

item.title: Nick Grimshaw on leaving Radio 1: 'I've interviewed everyone, twice'
item.description: The legendary presenter reflects on leaving BBC Radio 1 after 14 years.

item.title: Northern Turkey hit by severe flash flooding
item.description: Seventeen people have reportedly died, with more than 1,400 people evacuated from the areas affected.

item.title: Life in a town taken by the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: BBC correspondent Secunder Kermani reports from a town in Afghanistan recently taken by the Taliban

item.title: Coda: 'Deafness is not a costume you can put on,' says film director
item.description: The maker of the film Coda says being authentic to the story of child with deaf parents was vital.

item.title: How anti-vaxxers are living and loving in a Covid world
item.description: Opponents of Covid vaccines are turning to online dating and house shares for the unvaccinated only.

item.title: Afghanistan: How the Taliban gained ground so quickly
item.description: The situation looks bleak for the Afghan government, but there may still be a chance of a stalemate.

item.title: The fiendish new trick cyber-criminals are using to evade capture
item.description: Bitcoin researchers discover a new darknet tool criminals are using to help launder their digital money.

item.title: Can Americans pull the plug on petrol-powered cars?
item.description: Joe Biden wants half of all cars sold in the US to be zero emission by 2030 - but getting there won't be easy.

item.title: How can new technology protect outdoor workers?
item.description: Working outdoors in extreme heat can be deadly, new tech and better protection for workers could help.

item.title: Berlin embassy arrest: A case of old-school spying?
item.description: Why nothing in the case of the arrest of a man at the British Embassy in Berlin should surprise us.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban back brutal rule as they strike for power
item.description: Afghanistan's ex-rulers still back brutal punishments, the BBC finds as it goes behind Taliban lines.

item.title: Superb Rahul century punishes England at Lord's
item.description: England suffer a demoralising first day of the second Test as an unbeaten KL Rahul century leads India towards a huge total at Lord's.

item.title: Ten years on - how much better is Lukaku after rejoining Chelsea?
item.description: Why have Chelsea broken their transfer record to re-sign Romelu Lukaku - and how much better is he after returning to the club he first joined in 2011?

item.title: Big signings, new bosses, fans return & VAR dialled back - all you need to know as Premier League kicks off
item.description: All you need to know about the 2021-22 Premier League season as the season gets under way on Friday when newly-promoted Brentford host Arsenal.

item.title: 'They were unreal' - Superchargers hit Hundred's first 200 to hammer local rivals
item.description: Northern Superchargers rack up 200 in an incredible 69-run win over Manchester Originals as the visitors wilt at a raucous Headingley.

item.title: Dominant Celtic coast into Europa League play-offs
item.description: Celtic continue their recent resurgence as they strolled past the Czech Republic's FK Jablonec in the third qualifying round of the Europa League at Celtic Park.

item.title: Man City prepared to pay £127m for Kane - Friday's gossip
item.description: Man City are prepared to pay Tottenham £127m for Harry Kane, while PSG could look to sign Cristiano Ronaldo next summer, plus more.

item.title: Aston Martin withdraw appeal against Sebastian Vettel's disqualification in Hungary
item.description: Aston Martin withdraw their appeal against Sebastian Vettel's disqualification from second place in the Hungarian Grand Prix.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Lockdown rules are changing across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate, which workers are exempt and what if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: The rules in England and Northern Ireland will change from Monday 16 August.

item.title: Covid: What will school be like in the new term?
item.description: Pupils across the UK are preparing to return to school after the summer holidays.

item.title: Coronavirus: What do we know about the artemisia plant?
item.description: Artemisia plant extracts have anti-malarial properties, but there's no evidence they can combat Covid-19.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: UK holidays: What are the rules?
item.description: Going abroad is not straightforward, so many people are opting to stay in the UK for their holidays.

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in other parts of the UK.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government has announced that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: Malta: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism
item.description: How three teenagers rescued from the Mediterranean Sea ended up in Malta accused of terrorism.

item.title: ‘If only I’d found out earlier I had pelvic congestion syndrome’
item.description: Sophie Robehmed suffered from back and stomach pains for years before being diagnosed with PCS.

item.title: From Afghan interpreter to US homeless - the long road to the American dream
item.description: Thousands of Afghan interpreters have waited years to flee to the US. Arriving is a different story.
